result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L Krupa

defendant.name: Krupa, David L
defendant.address: W56 N437 Lenox Pl 1, Cedarburg, WI 53012

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
At request of attorney Stansbury and no objection by DA 11/28 status moved to 11/14.

Adjustment Number: 22A 151624,
Payable Number: 142806,
Receipt Number: 22R 011171,
Amount: $20.00
22R 010960   Bond posted at Sheriff's Dept on 10/24/2022.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. No contact with: TB. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

1:21 PM Defendant David L Krupa appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for David L Krupa as a friend of the court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant intends to retain private counsel. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $250 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel request signature bond. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
